title.narrative: OUTPUT 5:Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) MULTISTAKEHOLDER MECHANISM

description.narrative: National multi-stakeholder mechanisms functional and strengthened, mainstreaming water safety and community participation in water resource management and enforcing national sanitation policy., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, UNICEF contributed to Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector performance ensuring effective coverage of safe drinking water, improved knowledge, sanitation services and practices in most disadvantaged areas and healthy environment promoted

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF PROBATION CHILD CARE SERVICES NORTHERN PROVINCE
EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY UVA PROVINCE UNDER THE MINISTRY OF EDUCATION IN UVA

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National multi-stakeholder mechanisms functional and strengthened, mainstreaming water safety and community participation in waterresource management and enforcing national sanitation policy.

description.narrative: Water safety of community-managed and rural water schemes remained a priority for the Government, for which UNICEF generated evidence through research and an assessment of practices/capacity in drinking water quality surveillance in the Western Province. UNICEF also responded to the WASH needs of families affected by drought and flooding. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of scalable pilots on sanitation supported for advocacy
of key stakeholders adhered to joint accountability framework on equitable water safety concerns
of comprehensive knowledge products developed on water catchment protection, point of use, water safety and sanitation with focus on quality, equity and diverse audiences
Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector planning mechanism

baseline.value: National Watsan coordination meeting is held quartely under the chair of the Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply. This is the only multi-stakeholder platform for both mandated and non-mandated WASH stakeholders.

target.value: 2017:SDG Targets 6.1 and 6.2, Commitments for SACOSAN and DRR are integrated as core focus areas in the coordination platform.

actual.value: 2017:SDG 6.1 and 6.2 baselines established with targets yet to be set. SACOSAN commitments for Regional Center for Sanitation and 10th Intercountry Working Group Meeting fully met.Sector DRR identified as a key priority in WASH PDNA
